CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant claimed restitution of real property which had been expropriated from her in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Košice - mesto ORG ( Pozemkový úrad ) granted the applicant ’s claim . ORG established , after an inspection of the land in question , that it had never served the purpose for which it had been expropriated which was a relevant reason for its restitution within the meaning of LAW ( CARDINAL ) ( m ) of LAW of DATE . The educational institution which possessed the land challenged the decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Krajský súd ) quashed the administrative decision as it considered the reasons for it to be insufficient . ORG instructed the administrative authority to establish all relevant facts of the case and to hear the parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE both the applicant and a representative of the institution using the land in question met with officials of ORG úrad ) to which the case fell to be examined . In the course of the meeting the relevant facts of the case were examined .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG delivered a new decision by which it dismissed the applicant ’s claim . It held that the plot served the original purpose of its expropriation within the meaning of LAW ( CARDINAL ) ( m ) of LAW of DATE and that the applicant had received compensation for it . The decision was signed by the head of the land , agriculture and forest department of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested judicial review of this decision . She complained that ORG had failed to establish the relevant facts correctly , that it had decided arbitrarily and that there had been no hearing in the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision . The court found , with reference to the documents included in the file of ORG , that the plot in question served the purpose of its expropriation since a social institution used it as a playground for handicapped children . With reference to LAW , ORG decided in camera .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ( m ) of Act No . DATE on ORG And Other ORG ( ORG o úprave vlastníckych vzťahov k pôde a inému poľnohospodárskemu majetku – “ LAW ” ) , real property which was expropriated with payment of compensation shall be restored if it still exists and provided that it has never served the purpose for which it was expropriated .
CARDINAL . The lawfulness of decisions delivered by administrative authorities can be examined by courts in accordance with Part V of LAW which governs the administrative judiciary .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINALf , as in force at the relevant time , entitled the courts to deliver a judgment without prior oral hearing in simple cases , in particular when there is no doubt as to whether the administrative authority established the facts correctly , and the point at issue was a question of law .

CARDINAL . In accordance with LAW ( CARDINAL ) , the parties to the proceedings before the court are the parties in the proceedings before the administrative authority and the administrative authority whose decision is to be reviewed .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to Article CARDINALq ( CARDINAL ) , when the court reviewing an administrative authority ’s decision does not decide without an oral hearing pursuant to Article CARDINALf , it may take such evidence as is necessary for reviewing the decision at issue .
CARDINAL . Under Article ORG , if the court quashes the decision of the administrative authority , the latter , when taking a new decision , is bound by the legal opinion expressed by the court .

CARDINAL . Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on ORG ( PERSON o organizácii CARDINAL štátnej správy a o zmene a doplnení niektorých zákonov ) governs , inter alia , the status and competence of district offices .

CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provide that district offices are ORG authorities in charge of local administration of the ORG which are financed from the ORG budget .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) entitles the district offices to decide at first instance on the rights and obligations of natural or legal persons in the context of administrative proceedings .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , the head of a district office is appointed and revoked by the Government .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provides that the heads of departments of district offices are appointed by the head of the district office .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to Section CARDINAL , the departments of district offices shall act and decide in the context of administrative proceedings autonomously unless the law otherwise provides .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provides that district offices are directed and controlled by the Government when carrying out ORG administration .

CARDINAL . In its finding No . PL.ÚS CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ORG found that LAW was contrary to the LAW and also to LAW . As a result , this provision ceased to be effective from the moment of its publication in LAW on DATE .
